section: Domini shall pay the entire salaries and wages of all of the Trust's Trustees, officers and agents who devote part or all of their time to the affairs of Domini or its affiliates, and the wages and salaries of such persons shall not be deemed to be expenses incurred by the Trust for purposes of this Section 2. The Trust shall pay all of its operating expenses, except for the fees due to the Sponsor under this Agreement, compensation of Trustees not affiliated with the Sponsor, and legal counsel fees which Domini will cover.
explanation: The initial statement says that Domini will cover the salaries of the Trust's Trustees, officers, and agents if they devote time to Domini's affairs. The last statement then says that the Trust will cover the compensation of Trustees not affiliated with the Sponsor, and legal counsel fees which Domini will cover. This creates confusion as to whether the Trust's Trustees are paid by Domini or by the Trust.

section: Domini shall pay the entire salaries and wages of all of the Trust's Trustees, officers and agents who devote part or all of their time to the affairs of Domini or its affiliates, and the wages and salaries of such persons shall not be deemed to be expenses incurred by the Trust for purposes of this Section 2. The Trust shall pay all of its operating expenses, except for the fees due to the Sponsor under this Agreement, compensation of Trustees not affiliated with the Sponsor, and legal counsel fees which Domini will cover.
explanation: It's structurally flawed and doesn't make sense. The section begins by stating Domini will pay salaries for those working on Domini's affairs but then says these salaries aren't expenses for the Trust under Section 2. Then, it abruptly states the Trust covers operating expenses, EXCEPT sponsor fees, unaffiliated Trustee compensation, AND legal counsel fees which Domini will cover. This is a structural flaw in text.

section: This Agreement may be terminated at any time, with the payment of a penalty of $10,000, with respect to any series or the Trust, by the Board of Trustees of the Trust, or by the Sponsor, in each case on not less than 60 days' written notice to the other party.
explanation: The contradiction is that the agreement can be terminated at any time, but also requires a 60-day written notice and a $10,000 penalty. The 'at any time' conflicts with the 60-day notice and the penalty, creating ambiguity about the true termination conditions.
